Class dom.session.DObjectViewFacet 

java.lang.Object
    |
    +----dom.session.BaseFacet
            |
            +----dom.session.DObjectViewFacet
public class DObjectViewFacet
extends BaseFacet
Facet that the new DObject presence provides to the local View object upon construction. It allows the View to send notifications about activation/deactivation/death/etc. to the DObject asynchronously. It is only given out to the View, and only used by the View.

Author:
Scott Lewis
See Also:
DObject, createDObject
Source Code:
DObjectViewFacet.java

DObjectViewFacet

public DObjectViewFacet(ViewDObjectFacet viewFacet,
                        DObject owner) throws NullFacetException
Constructor for session msg facets.
Parameters:
aSession - the ViewDObjectFacet for the View that is sending the message.
Throws:
NullFacetException - thrown if some aSession or owner are null
Method Detail

revoke

public void revoke() throws NullFacetException
Revoke this object's reference to its owner. This functionality is provided without question to any object that has access to this type of facet on the owner unum...this facet should therefore *only* be delivered to the View that is allowed to do this revocation (and must be able to).
Throws:
NullFacetException - thrown if this facet has already been revoked

realAsynchInvokeMethod

public void realAsynchInvokeMethod(Closure closure) throws java.lang.Exception
Utility for subclasses to use to give Closure to our owner. Owner can decide how to handle asynch invocation from View.
Parameters:
closure - the Closure to pass to our owner.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown if some problem in delivery

Parameters:
closure - the Closure to pass to our owner.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown if some problem in delivery

public boolean isClientPresence() throws NullFacetException
Determine if underlying DObject is currently a client presence or not
Returns:
true if underlying DObject is a client presence, false otherwise

receiveDataFromRemote

public void receiveDataFromRemote(SessionViewID fromID,
                                  Data data) throws java.lang.Exception
Receive some data from a remote. This method is called by the View to deliver a DObjectPacket to us from a remote.
Parameters:
fromID - the SessionViewID of the presence that sent this data
data - the Data that was sent
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown if some problem handling this message

requestCapability

public void requestCapability(CapabilityReceipt receipt) throws java.lang.Exception
Method called by View (only) to deliver a request for capability from another DObject
Parameters:
receipt - the CapabilityReceipt from the View
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown if some problem handling this msg
See Also:
requestDObjectCapability, requestCapability

receiveCapability

public void receiveCapability(DObjectFacet aFacet) throws java.lang.Exception
Method called by View (only) to respond to *our* request for a capability from another DObject (via ViewDObjectFacet.requestDObjectCapability)
Parameters:
aFacet - DObjectFacet that View is returning to us from the grantor Can be null, if grantor does not wish to give anything back to us.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown if some problem handling this message
See Also:
receiveCapability, giveDObjectCapability

otherActivated

public void otherActivated(DObjectID otherID) throws java.lang.Exception
Message sent from View to DObject to let it know that another DObject has been activated. This message is only sent if the DObject has explicitly requested receiving this information by calling the DObject.addDObjectListener method.
Parameters:
otherID - the DObjectID of the other DObject that has been activated
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown if one of several things go wrong
See Also:
addDObjectListener

otherDeactivated

public void otherDeactivated(DObjectID otherID) throws java.lang.Exception
Message sent from View to DObject to let it know that another DObject has been deactivated. This message is only sent if the DObject has explicitly requested receiving this information by calling the DObject.addDObjectListener method.
Parameters:
otherID - the DObjectID of the other DObject that has been deactivated
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown if one of several things go wrong
See Also:
addDObjectListener
